titleStmt.title: Joseph Gratz to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1929

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: San Francisco, San Francisco County, California

body.p:
San Francisco 17th August 1864
To His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette
Frankfort
Kentucky
Sir

Having for several years had the honor of holding a commission from your predecessor as Commissioner of Deeds for your State and being about to remove from this city I desire to commend to your Excellencys favorable consideration the name of N. Proctor Smith Esq. as my successor

Mr Smith is not only one of our most estimable citizens but is in every way qualified to discharge the duties of the position and your Excellency may be assurred that his acts will reflect credit upon it

I have the honor to be
Your Excellencys
Obt Servt
Joseph Grantz

Comr Deeds
California
N. Proctor Smith
apptd
30th Sept 1864
